All Classes and Interfaces|All Packages

S

setBoard(Player) - Method in class LadderAndSnake
places the player into a square on the board, the two digit number corresponds to a specific array column and number uses the player's row and column attribute to locate where to put the player onto the board.
setColumn(int) - Method in class Player
this method sets the row number, which is important for identifying the column in the board array.
setNbOfplayers(int) - Method in class LadderAndSnake
This method will set the amount of players playing the Snakes and Ladders game.
setPlayerNb(int) - Method in class Player
sets the player number, which is used in the whoStarts method.
setPosition(int) - Method in class Player
The following will be used to set the player's square number that it is currently in.
setRow(int) - Method in class Player
this method sets the row number, which is important for identifying the row in the board array.
Snake(Player) - Static method in class LadderAndSnake
if a player lands on a square that has the head of a snake on it then they slide all the way down to a lower tile/square.
specialCondition(Player) - Method in class LadderAndSnake
Special condition: If a player rolls and lands a square that is already occupied by another player then the player who occupied the square first is kicked off and is sent off the board and must restart the game.
